# getBooleanEnv

Parse an environment to a boolean or throw error. If env does not exist, it returns the fallback value.

import:
```typescript copy
import { getBooleanEnv } from '@fullstacksjs/toolbox'
```

usage:
```typescript copy
getBooleanEnv(name, fallback): boolean | undefined
```

example:
```typescript copy
// j={} f=foo t=true f=false node
getBooleanEnv<TEnvKey>('j')         // <Error>
getBooleanEnv<TEnvKey>('f')         // <Error>
getBooleanEnv<TEnvKey>('t')         // true
getBooleanEnv<TEnvKey>('f')         // false
getBooleanEnv<TEnvKey>('n')         // undefined
getBooleanEnv<TEnvKey>('n', false)  // false
getBooleanEnv<TEnvKey>('n', true)   // true
```
